location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 1: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of Francis Warden's letter of 26 October 1820, which informed Dow that Lieutenant-Colonel Baker, the Commissary General, had been directed to visit the Persian Gulf for the purpose of ascertaining the resources of Keshme [Qeshm] and of the countries in its vicinity. Dow promises to assist Baker with his enquiries.
